alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 09 at 2:36PM MST until August 09 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... central Yavapai County near Ponderosa Park in Arizona... * Until 400 PM MST. * At 232 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near Ponderosa Park, south of Prescott. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... southern Prescott, Ponderosa Park, Indian Hill West Prescott, Downtown Prescott, Oak Knoll Village, Groom Creek Subdivision, Wilhoit, White Spar Campground, Lower Wolf Creek Campground and Upper Wolf Creek Group Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 near mile marker 296. State Route 89 between mile markers 296 and 314. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Copper Basin Wash, Butte Creek, Lynx Creek, Granite Creek, Miller Creek, Wolf Creek, Hassayampa River, Willow Creek, Sheppard Wash, Bannon Creek, Finch Wash, Skull Valley Wash, Kirkland Creek and Board Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. There are many low water crossings which will become dangerous. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Report any flooding to local law enforcement and the NWS Flagstaff when you can do so safely.
